title: Lesson 54 - The Short Form; Using Bare Roots

contents.markdown: Sometimes it is ok to just use a root, rather than a complete verb or adjective. I call this the “short” form. You will definitely hear this in colloquial speech, but it is less common than the “normal” form, so I will restrict it to this lesson only. Note that these roots may have stress/glottal stops different from full verbs/adjectives. Compare _magturo_ with _turò_ and _nakatutok_ with _tutók_.

item.english: Nalalaman ko, maganda siya. = I know she is beautiful.

item.tagalog: Sabi ni Joshua, ikinuha mo ako ng mangga.
item.english: Sinabi ni Joshua, ikinuha mo ako ng mangga. = Joshua said that you got me a mango.

item.tagalog: Sagot ni Angel, pupunta si Maria sa Pilipinas.
item.english: Sinagot ni Angel, pupunta si Maria sa Pilipinas. = Angel answered Maria will go to the Philippines.

contents.markdown: Ang + \*\*Root\*\*+ Ng form phrase = Sobrang + \*\*Adj\*\*+ Ang form phrase

item.english: Sobrang maganda ka. = You are very pretty.
Sobrang marami ang mga sasakyan. = There are very many cars.
Sobrang mura ang eskwelahang yun. = That school is very cheap.

contents.markdown: This structure is also used to exclaim “How adjective it is!”

item.english: Sobrang mainit ako! = How hot I am! = I am very hot!
Sobrang masaya ka na! = How happy you are already! = You are very happy already!

item.tagalog: Ang mura naman ng eskuwelahang yun!
item.english: Sobrang mura naman ng eskwelahang yun! = How cheap that school is (by contrast)! = That school is very cheap (by contrast)!

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sagot niya, nakatira sila sa pinakagusto nilang lugar.
exampleSentences.english: She answered, they lived in their favorite place.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ang takot namin nung nanood kami ng TV nung huling araw ng Setyembre.
exampleSentences.english: We were very frightened when we watched TV on the last day of September.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ang init ko! Parang nasa loob ako ng araw ngayon.
exampleSentences.english: How hot I am! It is like I am inside the sun now.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Biro niya, sobrang sikat ng babaeng nakasapatos sa tubig.
exampleSentences.english: He joked, "The woman wearing shoes in the water is very famous".

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ang tutok niya kapag naglalaro siya nang ganun, di ba?
exampleSentences.english: He is very focused when he plays like that, isn't he?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ang hirap ng taon! Gusto niyang magkapera, pero wala.
exampleSentences.english: How difficult the year is! She wants to have money, but she has none. (magka-)

exampleSentences.tagalog: Turo ni Mrs. Cruz, mas mabilis ang bus kaysa sa bisikleta.
exampleSentences.english: Mrs. Cruz pointed out the bus is faster than a bicycle.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ang ganda mo. Meron ka bang kasama?
exampleSentences.english: You are very pretty. Do you have a companion?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ang pagod ko! Nakakatuwa ito para sa iyo, pero kailangan kong matulog.
exampleSentences.english: How tired I am! It is fun for you, but I need to sleep.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Kita ko, mahirap maniwala sa ganitong sagot.
exampleSentences.english: I see it is difficult to believe such an answer.
